comments: I have few jira queries that can't be refreshed without bringing up vpn. Those queries loose their hits on Eclipse restart.

Not sure if it is related but I see the following error in the log. I don't think this thould go to the log in a first place, but should be reported as a sync job error.

java.net.UnknownHostException: *****
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(PlainSocketImpl.java:177)
at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(SocksSocketImpl.java:364)
at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:507)

This should be resolved now, but please verify.  Let me know if you want a dev build.  I also fixed a related bug with JIRA hits not being restored properly (e.g. completion status was 'forgotten' due to a problem with the externalization.
I would appreciated dev build if it is not a big trouble for you. Thanks.

Will plan to put one out before end of day.  Have you considered working bootstrapped?

http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/contributing.php#bootstrap
Mik, I still see this in 200600601-2000 build. After restart there is no query hits shown for jira repositories that can't be connected. This time I don't see any errors in the logs.

Now fixed--I was working disconnected over the weekend and had a chance to experience it first-hand ;)  

You'll still see errors in the log with the unavailable hostname and I'm filing a report against JIRA Dashboard.  Hope to have dev build tomorrow or early Wednesday.

(In reply to comment #7)

Great. New build would be good. I just realized that hits go away even after synchronization when repository can't be connected.
